definitions.definition: The quantity of bread or other baked goods baked at one time.
definitions.example: We made a batch of cookies to take to the party.

definitions.definition: (by extension) A quantity of anything produced at one operation.
definitions.example: We poured a bucket of water in at the top, and the ice-maker dispensed a batch of ice-cubes at the bottom.

definitions.definition: A group or collection of things of the same kind, such as a batch of letters or the next batch of business.
A set of data to be processed with one execution of a program.
definitions.example: The system throttled itself to batches of 50 requests at a time to keep the thread count under control.
She was the valedictorian of Batch '73.

definitions.definition: To aggregate things together into a batch.
definitions.example: The contractor batched the purchase orders for the entire month into one statement.

definitions.definition: To handle a set of input data or requests as a batch process.
definitions.example: The purchase requests for the day were stored in a queue and batched for printing the next morning.

definitions.definition: Of a process, operating for a defined set of conditions, and then halting.
definitions.example: The plant had two batch assembly lines for packaging, as well as a continuous feed production line.

definitions.definition: A field or patch of ground lying near a stream; the dale in which a stream flows.
To live as a bachelor temporarily, of a married man or someone virtually married.
definitions.example: I am batching next week when my wife visits her sister.
